channel.title: PI need some help
channel.description:
Hello
I would like to make so a player can click on an object and recieve an item, but i want to make so he can get the item only 1 time. I want to make something like when player try to get the item again it says "You have alredy recieved the item".
Could someone please help me?

item.title: PI need some help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Note: they should only need 1 free slot.
Another Note: to be specific with what item they receive from the case, you should use c.getItems().getItemName(int itemId); but heads up, since your code picks a new random int every time it’s called, it could say the wrong it (the way around this would be to store a case-specific int).

Read full topic

item.title: PI need some help
item.dc:creator: @ljoxaa ljoxaa
item.description:
@ljoxaa wrote:

Thanks for help guys, did it by my self and then seen that you have answered to my question.
I was doing it so player gets random item so did it this way:

Player Assistant: public static int Case[] = {11232,1042,1043,1044,4151}; public int randomCase() { return Present[(int)(Math.random()*Case.length)]; }

Click Object: case 10654: if(c.getItems().freeSlots() <= 1) { c.sendMessage("<shad=16776960>You need at least 2 free inventory slots to get your item!"); return; } if(c.case == false) { c.getItems().addItem(c.getPA().randomcase(), 1); c.sendMessage("<shad=65280>Enjoy your item from SCAPE"); c.case = true; }else if(c.case = true) { c.sendMessage("<shad=16711680>You have already received your item!"); }
and some code in playersave.

Thank you guys!

Read full topic

item.title: PI need some help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Stenen:

Int got more ways, so you can use if more often and you dont got that savegame etc. But yours works too ofc

Dude, he wants to give the item out ‘once’. Why the hell would you need an int for 0 and 1? That’s why I said boolean.

Read full topic

Thats possible to but mine is a little easier.

item.title: PI need some help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Stenen:

/snip

Why are you using ints for this? booleans would work so much better

This is how I’d go about it:
[hr]

Player.java:
Add a boolean, name it what ever, in this example I’m naming it “playerGotItem”

public boolean playerGotItem = false;

Next, in PlayerSave, we want to add the boolean in there, so the player cannot receive it more than once.
In public static int LoadGame(Client p, String playerName, String playerPass) {
Find:

Add this under it:

if (token.equals("playerGotItem")) { p.playerGotItem = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2); }
(Make sure you don’t add it within another statement, or in the wrong spot. If you add it after another statement, put ‘else’ before if)

Next in public static boolean saveGame(Client p)

Find:

characterfile.write("[CHARACTER]", 0, 11); characterfile.newLine();

Under it add:

characterfile.write("playerGotItem = ", 0, 16); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.playerGotItem), 0, Boolean.toString(p.playerGotItem).length()); characterfile.newLine();
0 in characterfile.write("playerGotItem = ", 0, 16); is the start and 16 is how many characters are going to be written to the file. it includes the two spaces and the equals sign.

Now in ActionHandler:
(This is all assumed because I don’t know the clicking ID of the object you’re using. Replace the #'s with the actual ID)

In public void firstClickObject(int objectType, int obX, int obY) {
Under: switch (objectType) {
Add:

case ####://Change this to the ID of the object if(!c.playerGotItem){//the ! (Bang) symbol essentially means 'false', so this is checking if playerGotItem is false c.getItems().addItem(@@@@, %);//Replace the @'s with the item you want the player to receive and the % with the amount of said item. c.playerGotItem = true;//Setting playerGotItem to true so they can't claim the item again. c.saveGame = true;//Saving the players game, this helps stops dupes. WARNING: Your saveGame variable may not be this exact thing. You may have to modify it. c.sendMessage("You open the <insert object name here> and receive "+c.getItems().getItemName(@@@@));//You're going to want to modify this statement. change the @'s. Also make it grammatically correct. }//Ending the if statement. else //If playerGotItem == true c.sendMessage("You've already used this <insert object name here>"); break;

Read full topic

item.title: PI need some help
item.dc:creator: @Stenen Stenen
item.description:
@Stenen wrote:

If you log out the boolean will go back to false so that doesnt work.

Player && playersave.java

Add

} else if (token.equals("ItemFromChest")) { p.ItemFromChest = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("ItemFromChest = ", 0, 16); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.ItemFromChest), 0, Integer.toString(p.ItemFromChest).length());

Actionhandler:

case objectid: if (c.ItemFromChest == 0){ c.getItems().addItem(Itemid, How much); c.ItemFromChest = 1; } else { sendMessage("You areally got the item"); } break

Read full topic

@lord0ftacos wrote:

I’m not sure on the actual code, I’ve moved on past PI and 317’s a long time ago. What I suggest doing though is on click the item puts it your inventory, and than writes a line in the character file saying like RecievedItem:True or False Hope this helped… Haven’t coded in months and I’m rusty.
